channel.title: CVE Feed for Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-26302|2024-08-02T00:07:19.011Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20clearpass%20policy%20manager
item.description: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of ClearPass Policy Manager could allow a remote attacker authenticated with low privileges to access sensitive information. A successful exploit allows an attacker to retrieve information which could be used to potentially gain further access to network services supported by ClearPass Policy Manager.

item.title: CVE-2024-26303|2024-08-02T00:07:19.028Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- arubaos-s%20switch
item.description: Authenticated Denial of Service Vulnerability in ArubaOS-Switch SSH Daemon

item.title: CVE-2024-26296|2024-08-02T00:07:19.027Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20clearpass%20policy%20manager
item.description: Vulnerabilities in the ClearPass Policy Manager web-based management interface allow remote authenticated users to run arbitrary commands on the underlying host. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system leading to complete system compromise.

item.title: CVE-2024-26299|2024-08-02T00:07:19.082Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20clearpass%20policy%20manager
item.description: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of ClearPass Policy Manager could allow an authenticated remote attacker to conduct a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against an administrative user of the interface. A successful exploit allows an attacker to execute arbitrary script code in a victim's browser in the context of the affected interface.

item.title: CVE-2024-26305|2024-08-02T00:07:19.370Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: There is a buffer overflow vulnerability in the underlying Utility daemon that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's access point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-26295|2024-08-02T00:07:19.403Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20clearpass%20policy%20manager
item.description: Vulnerabilities in the ClearPass Policy Manager web-based management interface allow remote authenticated users to run arbitrary commands on the underlying host. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system leading to complete system compromise.

item.title: CVE-2024-26304|2024-08-02T00:07:19.227Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: There is a buffer overflow vulnerability in the underlying L2/L3 Management service that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's access point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-26294|2024-08-02T00:07:18.955Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20clearpass%20policy%20manager
item.description: Vulnerabilities in the ClearPass Policy Manager web-based management interface allow remote authenticated users to run arbitrary commands on the underlying host. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system leading to complete system compromise.

item.title: CVE-2024-26300|2024-08-02T00:07:19.150Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20clearpass%20policy%20manager
item.description: A vulnerability in the guest interface of ClearPass Policy Manager could allow an authenticated remote attacker to conduct a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against an administrative user of the interface. A successful exploit allows an attacker to execute arbitrary script code in a victim's browser in the context of the affected interface.

item.description: Vulnerabilities in the ClearPass Policy Manager web-based management interface allow remote authenticated users to run arbitrary commands on the underlying host. item.description: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of ClearPass Policy Manager could allow a remote attacker authenticated with low privileges to access sensitive information. item.description: Vulnerabilities in the ClearPass Policy Manager web-based management interface allow remote authenticated users to run arbitrary commands on the underlying host. item.title: CVE-2024-5486|2024-08-01T21:11:12.793Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- clearpass%20policy%20manager%20%28cppm%29
item.description: A vulnerability exists in ClearPass Policy Manager that allows for an attacker with administrative privileges to access sensitive information in a cleartext format. A successful exploit allows an attacker to retrieve information which could be used to potentially gain further access to network services supported by ClearPass Policy Manager

item.title: CVE-2024-6206|2024-08-01T21:33:05.312Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- hpe%20athonet%20mobile%20core
item.description: A security vulnerability has been identified in HPE Athonet Mobile Core software. The core application contains a code injection vulnerability where a threat actor could execute arbitrary commands with the privilege of the underlying container leading to complete takeover of the target system.

item.title: CVE-2024-41916|2024-07-30T17:36:36.932Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- clearpass%20policy%20manager%20%28cppm%29
item.description: A vulnerability exists in ClearPass Policy Manager that allows for an attacker with administrative privileges to access sensitive information in a cleartext format. A successful exploit allows an attacker to retrieve information which could be used to potentially gain further access to network services supported by ClearPass Policy Manager.

item.title: CVE-2024-41915|2024-07-30T17:32:43.151Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- clearpass%20policy%20manager%20%28cppm%29
item.description: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of ClearPass Policy Manager could allow an authenticated remote attacker to conduct SQL injection attacks against the ClearPass Policy Manager instance. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain and modify sensitive information in the underlying database potentially leading to complete compromise of the ClearPass Policy Manager cluster.

item.title: CVE-2024-5486|2024-07-30T17:36:48.623Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- clearpass%20policy%20manager%20%28cppm%29

item.title: CVE-2024-41134|2024-07-25T14:33:02.051Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- hpe%20aruba%20networking%20edgeconnect%20sd-wan
item.description: A vulnerability exists in the HPE Aruba Networking EdgeConnect SD-WAN gateway's Command Line Interface that allows remote authenticated users to run arbitrary commands on the underlying host. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability will result in the ability to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system leading to complete system compromise

item.title: CVE-2024-25615|2024-07-24T16:26:16.309Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- arubaos%20wi-fi%20controllers%20and%20campus%2Fremote%20access%20points
item.description: An unauthenticated Denial-of-Service (DoS) vulnerability exists in the Spectrum service accessed via the PAPI protocol in ArubaOS 8.x. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to interrupt the normal operation of the affected service.

item.description: An unauthenticated Denial-of-Service (DoS) vulnerability exists in the Spectrum service accessed via the PAPI protocol in ArubaOS 8.x. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to interrupt the normal operation of the affected service.

item.title: CVE-2024-25614|2024-06-04T17:35:08.755Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- arubaos%20wi-fi%20controllers%20and%20campus%2Fremote%20access%20points
item.description: There is an arbitrary file deletion vulnerability in the CLI used by ArubaOS. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to delete arbitrary files on the underlying operating system, which could lead to denial-of-service conditions and impact the integrity of the controller.

item.description: Authenticated command injection vulnerabilities exist in the ArubaOS command line interface. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary commands as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.description: Authenticated command injection vulnerabilities exist in the ArubaOS command line interface. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary commands as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.description: Authenticated command injection vulnerabilities exist in the ArubaOS command line interface. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary commands as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-25616|2024-06-04T17:35:47.850Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- arubaos%20wi-fi%20controllers%20and%20campus%2Fremote%20access%20points
item.description: Aruba has identified certain configurations of ArubaOS that can lead to partial disclosure of sensitive information in the IKE_AUTH negotiation process. The scenarios in which disclosure of potentially sensitive information can occur are complex, and depend on factors beyond the control of attackers.

item.title: CVE-2024-31477|2024-06-06T16:59:03.824Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20instantos%20and%20aruba%20access%20points%20running%20arubaos%2010
item.description: Multiple authenticated command injection vulnerabilities exist in the command line interface. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary commands as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-31482|2024-06-06T17:01:42.878Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20instantos%20and%20aruba%20access%20points%20running%20arubaos%2010
item.description: An unauthenticated Denial-of-Service (DoS) vulnerability exists in the ANSI escape code service accessed via the PAPI protocol. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to interrupt the normal operation of the affected Access Point.

item.title: CVE-2024-31483|2024-06-06T17:02:29.084Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20instantos%20and%20aruba%20access%20points%20running%20arubaos%2010
item.description: An authenticated sensitive information disclosure vulnerability exists in the CLI service accessed via the PAPI protocol. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to read arbitrary files in the underlying operating system.

item.description: Multiple authenticated command injection vulnerabilities exist in the command line interface. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary commands as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.description: There is a command injection vulnerability in the underlying Central Communications service that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). item.description: There is a buffer overflow vulnerability in the underlying Local User Authentication Database service that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's access point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-33511|2024-06-04T17:44:44.495Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: There is a buffer overflow vulnerability in the underlying Automatic Reporting service that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's access point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-33517|2024-05-01T16:33:15.277Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: An unauthenticated Denial-of-Service (DoS) vulnerability exists in the Radio Frequency Manager service accessed via the PAPI protocol. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to interrupt the normal operation of the affected service.

item.title: CVE-2024-33516|2024-06-04T17:45:25.154Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: An unauthenticated Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability exists in the Auth service accessed via the PAPI protocol provided by ArubaOS. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to interrupt the normal operation of the controller.

item.title: CVE-2024-26296|2024-02-27T21:57:24.846Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20clearpass%20policy%20manager
item.description: Vulnerabilities in the ClearPass Policy Manager web-based management interface allow remote authenticated users to run arbitrary commands on the underlying host. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system leading to complete system compromise.

item.title: CVE-2024-26297|2024-02-27T22:03:55.507Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20clearpass%20policy%20manager
item.description: Vulnerabilities in the ClearPass Policy Manager web-based management interface allow remote authenticated users to run arbitrary commands on the underlying host. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system leading to complete system compromise.

item.title: CVE-2024-26300|2024-06-04T17:48:35.013Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20clearpass%20policy%20manager
item.description: A vulnerability in the guest interface of ClearPass Policy Manager could allow an authenticated remote attacker to conduct a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against an administrative user of the interface. A successful exploit allows an attacker to execute arbitrary script code in a victim's browser in the context of the affected interface.

item.title: CVE-2024-26301|2024-02-27T22:10:54.804Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20clearpass%20policy%20manager
item.description: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of ClearPass Policy Manager could allow a remote attacker authenticated with low privileges to access sensitive information. A successful exploit allows an attacker to retrieve information which could be used to potentially gain further access to network services supported by ClearPass Policy Manager.

item.title: CVE-2024-26302|2024-06-04T17:48:59.161Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20clearpass%20policy%20manager
item.description: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of ClearPass Policy Manager could allow a remote attacker authenticated with low privileges to access sensitive information. A successful exploit allows an attacker to retrieve information which could be used to potentially gain further access to network services supported by ClearPass Policy Manager.

item.description: Aruba has identified certain configurations of ArubaOS that can lead to partial disclosure of sensitive information in the IKE_AUTH negotiation process.
